learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate limits, derivatives, and integrals, explain the underlying mathematical basis, interpret the results geometrically, and perform calculations associated with a number of applications;
Understand and evaluate the limits of sequences and series, and use them to approximate functions;
Work with matrices and vectors including a complete understanding of the behaviour of an m * n linear system;
Understand the concept of invertibility for matrices, know many criteria for invertibility and be able to find inverses;
Understand abstract concepts in linear algebra such as vector space, dimension and basis, and be able to construct simple proofs involving these concepts;

assessments.due_date: Practicals are due each week from week 2 – week 13 except for weeks an assignment is due 3/03/2025 - 30/05/2025
assessments.task_description: You will complete a collaborative exercise at the practical each week. No practical exercise will be due on days when one of the two assignments is due.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assessment is completed within the scheduled practical time and turned in in-person at the end of the practical.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: The final examination will be invigilated on-campus for students enrolled in in-person mode and invigilated over Zoom for students in external mode. You must attend the format allocated for your type of enrolment (in-person/external) unless given prior permission to attend the other format. Further details for each format will be provided to students before the examination period. Alternative arrangements will be advised on Blackboard should the campus be closed for any reason.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Date: You must hold all of the following three Saturdays free until the exam date is officially announced

  • Saturday 29 March, 2025
  • Saturday 5 April, 2025
  • Saturday 12 April 2025


The in-semester examination will be invigilated on-campus for students enrolled in in-person mode and invigilated over Zoom for students in external mode. You must attend the format allocated for your type of enrolment (in-person/external) unless given prior permission to attend the other format. Further details for each format will be provided to students before the examination period. Alternative arrangements will be advised on Blackboard should the campus be closed for any reason. The exam with consist of a range of short-answer and problem-solving questions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: You must submit detailed written solutions to a collection of mathematical problems. All assignments are weighted equally.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Follow the submission instructions on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Independent Study

During the semester students are expected to work on MATH1051 outside of class time to consolidate the information given during lectures, work on the problem sheets and assignments, complete extra practice problems and study for examinations.
learning_activities.topic_description: Independent Study During the semester students are expected to work on MATH1051 outside of class time to consolidate the information given during lectures, work on the problem sheets and assignments, complete extra practice problems and study for examinations.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Practicals

In the workshops students will complete collaborative worksheets, receive help on various assessments, get corrected assignments returned, be able to ask questions on the problem sheets, and be able to ask general questions related to course work.
learning_activities.topic_description: Practicals In the workshops students will complete collaborative worksheets, receive help on various assessments, get corrected assignments returned, be able to ask questions on the problem sheets, and be able to ask general questions related to course work.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Lecture

Students may choose to attend either face-to-face lectures (on campus) or view the online lectures. The online lectures will cover the same content as the face-to-face lectures. Both face-to-face and online lectures are centred around the workbook, so it is vital that students have their workbook with them for both face-to-face and online lectures. As well as completing the workbook in a comprehensive manner, students will be provided with additional material and examples. Students electing to simply download the completed workbook from Blackboard after each chapter is finished will hence be missing material.
